page.title: 17Sail-Lofts
page.content: By the estuary there are four sail lofts dating probably from the late 19th century. They are timber framed and weather boarded and raised on saddle stones. They are two storeys high with casement windows. In the west gabieenels fronting into the road, are sliding doors of horizontal boarding, on each floor, the upper ones approached by ladders. Three of the lofts have hoist tackle to the roof space. The roofs are of corrugated iron, except for the most southern loft, which has a recent asbestos roof. These lofts have recently been renovated by the Manpower Services Commission on a job_creation scheme and won a Conservation and Design Award.
